current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the Senate that the
		  Food and Drug Administration should encourage the use of abuse-deterrent
		  formulations of drugs.

Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and

) submitted the following

text.#text: That it is the sense of the

refuse to approve

require generic

Whereas when abuse-deterrent formulations of a drug have

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of National Drug Control Policy

text.#text:
Whereas in response, several opioid drug manufacturers
			 have developed abuse-deterrent formulations;

Whereas efforts to reduce the level of abuse of opioid
			 drug products are dependent on the widespread adoption of new technologies and
			 approaches to the safer formulation of these drugs; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has the authority under
			 current law to require generic versions of products that have been formulated
			 or reformulated with abuse-deterrent features to have comparable features: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 97 IS: Expressing the sense of the Senate that the Food and Drug Administration should encourage the use of abuse-deterrent formulations of drugs.
